TextFrame.Text: Reduce the scope of the goals using coordinates[Original goal]To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modificationLower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop[Alternative goal]Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by editPrevent errors

Runs.Text: Reduce the scope of the goals using coordinates
[Original goal]To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modificationLower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop[Alternative goal]
Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by edit

Paragraphs.Text: To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modification
Lower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop
Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by edit
Prevent errors

TextFrame.Text: Focus of Existing Research (PPTAgent, etc …)Prior work has mainly focused on having AI create PPT slides from scratch.Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.→ In many cases, lightweight tools like python-pptx are sufficient.Strong persuasion of complexity in editing human‑made PPTs Editing a human-generated PPT and generating one from scratch is totally different.→ Editing can actually be more complex than generation.Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.→ Reason of using visual models / heavy tools like win32com

Runs.Text: Prior work has mainly focused on having
AI create PPT slides from scratch.
Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.→ In many cases, lightweight tools like python-pptx are sufficient.
one from scratch is totally different.
→ Editing can actually be more complex than generation.Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.
→ Reason of using visual models / heavy tools like win32com

Paragraphs.Text: Prior work has mainly focused on having AI create PPT slides from scratch.
Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.
Editing a human-generated PPT and generating one from scratch is totally different.
Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.

TextFrame.Text: Action을 좀 더 구체적으로 뱉을 수 있도록 Prompt 조절구체성 + 어느정도의 direction or guideline 제시하는 것이 좋을듯(i.e.,Text overflow일 때는 size fix -> align -> text size조절 단계로 진행하라)Prompting 분기로 Model handling일단은 gemini가 좀 더 좋은 느낌.민감하게 반응하는 gemini에 제한을 빡세게 거는것둔감하게 반응하는 GPT에 제한을 푸는거Slide outlier handling여기서 coordinate를 활용할 수 있을듯?수정 후에 화면 밖으로 나가는거는 python으로 잡거나, 안되면 LLM callVision/LLM validation loop 이전에 넣는것도 고려해볼 만함.. 위치 선정최종적으로 human eye 수준의 큰 visual error를 검증해내는 loop 구현을 목표

TextFrame.Text: “모든 본문에서 실제 bullet point는 아닌데 ‘-’가 들어가 있는 경우가 있어. 이 경우에 이를 제거하고 실제로 bullet point화해”

Runs.Text: “모든 본문에서 실제 bullet point는 아닌데 ‘-’가 들어가 있는 경우가 있어. 이 경우에 이를 제거하고 실제로 bullet point화해”

TextFrame.Text: Text 앞의 ‘-’ 등을 보면 bullet point화 시킬까? -> 굳이..책임의 영역. 의도적으로 bullet point 대신 str으로 했을 수 있는데, 개발자 선에서 선제적으로 판단하여 bullet point화 할 것은 아닌듯.

TextFrame.Text: 이미지 Loop의 호출 횟수가 좀 많을수도 있을거같다는 생각….기존 talk-to-your-slides의 컨셉에는 조금 위배될지도?Win32com 이용하는 만큼, 애니메이션이든 뭐든 화려한거, 최대한 들어갈 수 있을만큼 넣는게 좋을듯진행방향1차적으로 Massive하게 작동되도록 만든 뒤 다양한 case 실험 -> 개선 반복2차적으로 cost/time 줄여가는 방향, token 절약, 비동기 처리 등등 최적화

Runs.Text: 이미지 Loop의 호출 횟수가 좀 많을수도 있을거같다는 생각….기존 talk-to-your-slides의 컨셉에는 조금 위배될지도?Win32com 이용하는 만큼, 애니메이션이든 뭐든 화려한거, 최대한 들어갈 수 있을만큼 넣는게 좋을듯진행방향1차적으로 Massive하게 작동되도록 만든 뒤 다양한 case 실험 -> 개선 반복2차적으로 cost/time 줄여가는 방향, token 절약, 비동기 처리 등등 최적화

Paragraphs.Text: 이미지 Loop의 호출 횟수가 좀 많을수도 있을거같다는 생각….
기존 talk-to-your-slides의 컨셉에는 조금 위배될지도?
Win32com 이용하는 만큼, 애니메이션이든 뭐든 화려한거, 최대한 들어갈 수 있을만큼 넣는게 좋을듯
진행방향
1차적으로 Massive하게 작동되도록 만든 뒤 다양한 case 실험 -> 개선 반복
2차적으로 cost/time 줄여가는 방향, token 절약, 비동기 처리 등등 최적화

TextFrame.Text: Action을 좀 더 구체적으로 뱉을 수 있도록 Prompt 조절구체성 + 어느정도의 direction or guideline 제시하는 것이 좋을듯(i.e.,Text overflow일 때는 size fix -> align -> text size조절 단계로 진행하라)Prompting 분기로 Model handling일단은 gemini가 좀 더 좋은 느낌.민감하게 반응하는 gemini에 제한을 빡세게 거는것둔감하게 반응하는 GPT에 제한을 푸는거Slide outlier handling여기서 coordinate를 활용할 수 있을듯?수정 후에 화면 밖으로 나가는거는 python으로 잡거나, 안되면 LLM callVision/LLM validation loop 이전에 넣는것도 고려해볼 만함.. 위치 선정최종적으로 human eye 수준의 큰 visual error를 검증해내는 loop 구현을 목표

TextFrame.Text: “모든 본문에서 실제 bullet point는 아닌데 ‘-’가 들어가 있는 경우가 있어. 이 경우에 이를 제거하고 실제로 bullet point화해”

Runs.Text: “모든 본문에서 실제 bullet point는 아닌데 ‘-’가 들어가 있는 경우가 있어. 이 경우에 이를 제거하고 실제로 bullet point화해”

TextFrame.Text: Text 앞의 ‘-’ 등을 보면 bullet point화 시킬까? -> 굳이..책임의 영역. 의도적으로 bullet point 대신 str으로 했을 수 있는데, 개발자 선에서 선제적으로 판단하여 bullet point화 할 것은 아닌듯.

TextFrame.Text: 이미지 Loop의 호출 횟수가 좀 많을수도 있을거같다는 생각….기존 talk-to-your-slides의 컨셉에는 조금 위배될지도?Win32com 이용하는 만큼, 애니메이션이든 뭐든 화려한거, 최대한 들어갈 수 있을만큼 넣는게 좋을듯진행방향1차적으로 Massive하게 작동되도록 만든 뒤 다양한 case 실험 -> 개선 반복2차적으로 cost/time 줄여가는 방향, token 절약, 비동기 처리 등등 최적화

TextFrame.Text: Reduce the scope of the goals using coordinates[Original goal]To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modificationLower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop[Alternative goal]Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by editPrevent errors

Runs.Text: Reduce the scope of the goals using coordinates
[Original goal]To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modificationLower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop[Alternative goal]
Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by edit

Paragraphs.Text: To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modification
Lower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop
Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by edit
Prevent errors

TextFrame.Text: Focus of Existing Research (PPTAgent, etc …)Prior work has mainly focused on having AI create PPT slides from scratch.Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.→ In many cases, lightweight tools like python-pptx are sufficient.Strong persuasion of complexity in editing human‑made PPTs Editing a human-generated PPT and generating one from scratch is totally different.→ Editing can actually be more complex than generation.Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.→ Reason of using visual models / heavy tools like win32com

Runs.Text: Prior work has mainly focused on having
AI create PPT slides from scratch.
Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.→ In many cases, lightweight tools like python-pptx are sufficient.
one from scratch is totally different.
→ Editing can actually be more complex than generation.Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.
→ Reason of using visual models / heavy tools like win32com

Paragraphs.Text: Prior work has mainly focused on having AI create PPT slides from scratch.
Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.
Editing a human-generated PPT and generating one from scratch is totally different.
Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.

TextFrame.Text: 이미지 Loop의 호출 횟수가 좀 많을수도 있을거같다는 생각….기존 talk-to-your-slides의 컨셉에는 조금 위배될지도?Win32com 이용하는 만큼, 애니메이션이든 뭐든 화려한거, 최대한 들어갈 수 있을만큼 넣는게 좋을듯진행방향1차적으로 Massive하게 작동되도록 만든 뒤 다양한 case 실험 -> 개선 반복2차적으로 cost/time 줄여가는 방향, token 절약, 비동기 처리 등등 최적화

TextFrame.Text: Reduce the scope of the goals using coordinates[Original goal]To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modificationLower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop[Alternative goal]Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by editPrevent errors

Runs.Text: Reduce the scope of the goals using coordinates
[Original goal]To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modificationLower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop[Alternative goal]
Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by edit

Paragraphs.Text: To get precise location information before & after edit, enable Accurate modification
Lower the time/cost of LLM call & MLLM vision loop
Only detect slide outliers (shape out of screen) caused by edit
Prevent errors

TextFrame.Text: Focus of Existing Research (PPTAgent, etc …)Prior work has mainly focused on having AI create PPT slides from scratch.Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.→ In many cases, lightweight tools like python-pptx are sufficient.Strong persuasion of complexity in editing human‑made PPTs Editing a human-generated PPT and generating one from scratch is totally different.→ Editing can actually be more complex than generation.Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.→ Reason of using visual models / heavy tools like win32com

Runs.Text: Prior work has mainly focused on having
AI create PPT slides from scratch.
Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.→ In many cases, lightweight tools like python-pptx are sufficient.
one from scratch is totally different.
→ Editing can actually be more complex than generation.Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.
→ Reason of using visual models / heavy tools like win32com

Paragraphs.Text: Prior work has mainly focused on having AI create PPT slides from scratch.
Slide structures are standardized,and text/layout patterns are fairly predictable, making edits relatively simple.
Editing a human-generated PPT and generating one from scratch is totally different.
Formatting, alignment, captured images, and arbitrary placements are all inconsistent.

TextFrame.Text: Action을 좀 더 구체적으로 뱉을 수 있도록 Prompt 조절구체성 + 어느정도의 direction or guideline 제시하는 것이 좋을듯(i.e.,Text overflow일 때는 size fix -> align -> text size조절 단계로 진행하라)Prompting 분기로 Model handling일단은 gemini가 좀 더 좋은 느낌.민감하게 반응하는 gemini에 제한을 빡세게 거는것둔감하게 반응하는 GPT에 제한을 푸는거Slide outlier handling여기서 coordinate를 활용할 수 있을듯?수정 후에 화면 밖으로 나가는거는 python으로 잡거나, 안되면 LLM callVision/LLM validation loop 이전에 넣는것도 고려해볼 만함.. 위치 선정최종적으로 human eye 수준의 큰 visual error를 검증해내는 loop 구현을 목표
